newsitem.title: FRANCE: Strauss-Kahn says EU needs time for EMU pact.
newsitem.headline: Strauss-Kahn says EU needs time for EMU pact.

text.p: French Finance Minister Dominique Strauss-Kahn said on Friday Europe needed time for its discussions on a budget stability pact limiting budget deficits after the launch of a single currency.
He said, after a Franco-German summit which failed to finalise an agreement on the stability pact, that France had raised questions about the pact on Monday and now it was only Friday.
"Things don't change in a day, we are in discussions. I am a pragmatist. We are not going to get stuck on one formula," he told reporters.
"We want to reach an accord. It is not impossible. We spoke for two hours. Two hours is not enough work," he said.
He said no one in the European Union was seeking a big new spending programme.
"I agree with the Chancellor (Helmut Kohl) when he says no one is in a position for big spending," he said.
"Those who say we have a huge problem are wrong. Those who say we have no problem are wrong. We have a problem are we are going to solve it," he said.
